Web Scrapers¶

The scrapers module provides high-level interfaces for orchestrating the article scraping process.

Wired Article Scraper¶

class the_data_packet.scrapers.WiredArticleScraper(timeout: int = 30, user_agent: str | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Main scraper for extracting articles from Wired.com.

__init__(timeout: int = 30, user_agent: str | None = None)[source]¶

Initialize the Wired article scraper.

Parameters:

  • timeout – HTTP request timeout in seconds

  • user_agent – Custom User-Agent string for HTTP requests

The WiredArticleScraper is the main orchestrator that combines RSS feeds, HTTP clients, and content extractors to provide a simple interface for scraping Wired articles.

Key Features:

  • Category Support: Handles ‘security’ and ‘guide’ article categories

  • Batch Operations: Can fetch multiple articles at once

  • Resource Management: Automatic cleanup of HTTP sessions

  • Error Handling: Comprehensive error reporting and recovery

Example Usage:

from the_data_packet.scrapers import WiredArticleScraper

# Create scraper with custom timeout
scraper = WiredArticleScraper(timeout=60)

# Get latest security article
security_article = scraper.get_latest_article("security")

# Get latest guide article
guide_article = scraper.get_latest_article("guide")

# Get both latest articles at once
both_articles = scraper.get_both_latest_articles()
print(f"Security: {both_articles['security'].title}")
print(f"Guide: {both_articles['guide'].title}")

# Get multiple articles from a category
articles = scraper.get_multiple_articles("security", limit=5)
for i, article in enumerate(articles, 1):
    print(f"{i}. {article.title}")

# Scrape a specific URL
article = scraper.scrape_article_from_url(
    "https://www.wired.com/story/specific-article/",
    category="custom"
)

# Always clean up resources
scraper.close()
__init__(timeout: int = 30, user_agent: str | None = None)[source]¶

Initialize the Wired article scraper.

Parameters:

  • timeout – HTTP request timeout in seconds

  • user_agent – Custom User-Agent string for HTTP requests

get_latest_article(category: str) → ArticleData[source]¶

Get the latest article from a specific category.

Parameters:

category – Category to fetch from (‘security’ or ‘guide’)

Returns:

ArticleData object with extracted article information

Raises:

  • ValueError – If category is not supported

  • RuntimeError – If scraping fails

get_latest_security_article() → ArticleData[source]¶

Get the latest security article.

get_latest_guide_article() → ArticleData[source]¶

Get the latest guide article.

get_both_latest_articles() → Dict[str, ArticleData][source]¶

Get both latest security and guide articles.

Returns:

Dictionary with ‘security’ and ‘guide’ keys containing ArticleData objects

get_multiple_articles(category: str, limit: int = 5) → List[ArticleData][source]¶

Get multiple articles from a specific category.

Parameters:

  • category – Category to fetch from

  • limit – Maximum number of articles to fetch

Returns:

List of ArticleData objects

scrape_article_from_url(url: str, category: str | None = None) → ArticleData[source]¶

Scrape a specific article from its URL.

Parameters:

  • url – The article URL to scrape

  • category – Optional category to assign to the article

Returns:

ArticleData object with extracted article information

close() → None[source]¶

Close HTTP connections and clean up resources.

Method Details¶

Latest Article Methods¶

WiredArticleScraper.get_latest_article(category: str) → ArticleData[source]¶

Get the latest article from a specific category.

Parameters:

category – Category to fetch from (‘security’ or ‘guide’)

Returns:

ArticleData object with extracted article information

Raises:

  • ValueError – If category is not supported

  • RuntimeError – If scraping fails

Generic method for fetching the latest article from any supported category.

WiredArticleScraper.get_latest_security_article() → ArticleData[source]¶

Get the latest security article.

Convenience method specifically for security articles.

WiredArticleScraper.get_latest_guide_article() → ArticleData[source]¶

Get the latest guide article.

Convenience method specifically for guide articles.

WiredArticleScraper.get_both_latest_articles() → Dict[str, ArticleData][source]¶

Get both latest security and guide articles.

Returns:

Dictionary with ‘security’ and ‘guide’ keys containing ArticleData objects

Efficiently fetches both latest security and guide articles.

Batch Operations¶

WiredArticleScraper.get_multiple_articles(category: str, limit: int = 5) → List[ArticleData][source]¶

Get multiple articles from a specific category.

Parameters:

  • category – Category to fetch from

  • limit – Maximum number of articles to fetch

Returns:

List of ArticleData objects

Fetches multiple articles from a category with configurable limits.

Direct URL Scraping¶

WiredArticleScraper.scrape_article_from_url(url: str, category: str | None = None) → ArticleData[source]¶

Scrape a specific article from its URL.

Parameters:

  • url – The article URL to scrape

  • category – Optional category to assign to the article

Returns:

ArticleData object with extracted article information

Scrapes a specific article URL directly, bypassing RSS feeds.

Properly closes HTTP sessions and cleans up resources.
